newsitem.title: USA: Three AT&T wireless executives join McCaw-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Three AT&T wireless executives join McCaw-WSJ.

text.p: Three top executives of AT&T Corp's wireless-services unit have left to form a joint venture in competitive local telephone services with Craig McCaw, their former boss, the Wall Street Journal said in its electronic edition on Thursday.
Steven Hooper, president of AT&T Wireless, has already been replaced by Daniel Hesse, who supervised Inernet services, the paper said, citing people close to AT&T.
Wayne Perry, vice chairman of AT&T Wireless, and Gerald Salemme, who helped AT&T's lobbying efforts on new telecommunications legislation, also resigned, the paper said.
The Journal said none of the executives could be reached for comment and AT&T declined to comment.
The paper said the resignations could be announced as early as today.
